ai.summary: Crowan BR 76 is a very short, easy hike in the UK covering about 0.7 km. It is suitable for beginners and families seeking a quick outdoor experience with minimal ascent and straightforward paths.
ai.terrain_summary: The route is on mostly flat, easy surfaces such as compacted footpaths and short grassy sections. Expect occasional gravel and be prepared for damp or muddy patches after rain.
ai.safety_notes: Check the forecast and daylight hours; stay on marked paths; wear sturdy footwear and carry a light layer; bring water and a small first-aid item if needed; share your plan and estimated return time with someone; be mindful of potential road crossings and rural sections common in UK hikes.
recommended_gear: Map or offline route (or smartphone with charged battery)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October). The hike is enjoyable year-round, but expect mud and colder conditions in winter.

seo.title: Crowan BR 76 – Easy 0.7 km Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover Crowan BR 76, a short 0.7 km easy hike in the UK. Learn about the terrain, safety tips, best seasons, and recommended gear for a quick outdoor outing.
